intro: Castalia amazonum, commonly known as the Amazon castalia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Castalia amazonum thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
